member.name: M:Vidyano.Service.Repository.PersistentObjectActions`2.OnNew(Vidyano.Service.Repository.PersistentObject,Vidyano.Service.Repository.PersistentObject,Vidyano.Service.Repository.Query,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Called when a new is requested.
member.remarks: The OnNew method is used to generate the Persistent Object that will be shown on a new Page, and will be invoked if the user clicks on the New action on a Query. The New action is available when the current user has the New right for the Persistent Object. If the Persistent Object has NewOptions, the parameters dictionary contains a MenuOption entry that has the index of the selected menuoption when creating a new Entity. e.g. PersistentObject.NewOptions = Option1;Option2 and the user clicks on Option2 then parameters*MenuOptions+ will contain 1 meaning index 1. the base implementation will use the method to create a new entity, from which all properties will be read to fill the new Persistent Object. The Breadcrumb will be set using the translatable NewObjectBreadcrumb message. If the parent is not empty, Vidyano will look for Persistent Object Attributes of the same type; if only one is found, the value of this attribute will be set to the parents value and be made read-only. note: this method should create a new instance, not save a new instance.
member.param: The newly created Persistent Object that will be displayed in the new Page.
The optional parent for the Query that was used to create this new Persistent Object.
Contains the Query from which the New action was invoked.
Contains any optional parameters that can be used to determine which entity should be created.

member.param: The arguments for this method that contain the PersistentObject and PersistentObjectAttribute that caused this action.
member.remarks: The Refresh action is invoked when a PersistentObjectAttribute is changed and has its TriggersRefresh property set to true. The OnRefresh method can be used to modify other attributes when a certain value is set. Attributes can be set to IsReadOnly, IsHidden and Rules can be added. Does nothing by default.

member.remarks: This action will be invoked when the user has made changes to a Persistent Object and clicks the Save button. The OnSave method will check if the property is set to true, then the method will be invoked, otherwise the method will be invoked. Finally the method will be called to save all attributes. should be called after changes are made.

The optional colon separated accept parameter for the client that indiciates which type of file should be uploaded, e.g.: ".pdf, .csv, text/plain"
Indicates whether the query should be refreshed after the import has been successfully executed.
The optional custom options that should be shown on the client.
member.returns: Returns a persistent object that will inform the client to upload a file.

member.name: T:Vidyano.Core.Security.Cryptography.BCrypt
member.summary: BCrypt implementation.

remarks.para: BCrypt implements OpenBSD-style Blowfish password hashing using the scheme described in "A Future- Adaptable Password Scheme" by Niels Provos and David Mazieres.

This password hashing system tries to thwart off-line password cracking using a computationally-intensive hashing algorithm, based on Bruce Schneier's Blowfish cipher. The work factor of the algorithm is parameterised, so it can be increased as computers get faster.
Usage is really simple. To hash a password for the first time, call the method with a random salt, like this:
To check whether a plaintext password matches one that has been hashed previously, use the method:
The method takes an optional parameter (workFactor) that determines the computational complexity of the hashing:
remarks.code: string strong_salt = BCrypt.GenerateSalt(10); string stronger_salt = BCrypt.GenerateSalt(12);
remarks.para: The amount of work increases exponentially (2^workFactor), so each increment is twice as much work. The default workFactor is 10, and the valid range is 4 to 31.
